articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';

Brasileiros tÃªm uma grande vantagem ao aprender espanhol - os idiomas sÃ£o muito similares! Mas essa semelhanÃ§a tambÃ©m pode ser uma armadilha. Muitos erros vÃªm justamente de assumir que tudo funciona igual. Vamos identificar e corrigir os erros mais comuns.

## Frase do Dia

<PhraseOfDay
  word="No tengo vergÃ¼enza de cometer errores - asÃ­ aprendo"
  translation="NÃ£o tenho vergonha de cometer erros - assim aprendo"
  pronunciation="no TEN-go ver-GUEN-sa de ko-me-TER e-RRO-res - a-SI a-PREN-do"
  context="A atitude certa para aprender qualquer idioma!"
/>

## Falsos Cognatos: Os Piores VilÃµes

### VergÃ¼enza â‰  Vergonha

<VocabCard

/>

/>

<VocabCard

  example="El camino es muy largo. (O caminho Ã© muito longo)"
/>

<CultureTip title="O Famoso Embarazada" flag="ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¸">
O erro mais embaraÃ§oso (ironicamente!) Ã© dizer "Estoy embarazada" quando vocÃª quer dizer que estÃ¡ envergonhado. VocÃª acabou de dizer que estÃ¡ grÃ¡vida! O correto Ã© "Estoy avergonzado/a".
</CultureTip>

## Mais Falsos Amigos Perigosos

| Espanhol | Parece | Significa |
|----------|--------|-----------|
| Borracha | Borracha | BÃªbada |

| Rato | Rato | Momento |
| Oficina | Oficina | EscritÃ³rio |

| Copa | Copa | TaÃ§a (de vinho) |

<VocabCard
  word="Dame un rato"
  translation="Me dÃ¡ um momento (nÃ£o um rato!)"
  pronunciation="DA-me un RA-to"
  example="Espera, dame un rato y te llamo."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Â¿CuÃ¡l es tu apellido?"
  translation="Qual Ã© seu sobrenome? (nÃ£o apelido!)"

  example="Mi apellido es GarcÃ­a."
/>

## Erros de PronÃºncia

### O Som do J e G

  word="Trabajo"
  translation="Trabalho"
  pronunciation="tra-BA-jo (J = RR forte)"
  example="Voy al trabajo. (J soa como RR aspirado, nÃ£o DJ)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Gente"
  translation="Gente"
  pronunciation="JEN-te (G antes de E/I = J)"
  example="Hay mucha gente aquÃ­."
/>

### O Som do Ã‘

<VocabCard
  word="AÃ±o"
  translation="Ano"
  pronunciation="A-nho (nÃ£o A-no!)"
  example="Llevamos un aÃ±o juntos."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="NiÃ±o"
  translation="Menino"
  pronunciation="NI-nho"
  example="El niÃ±o es muy simpÃ¡tico."
/>

<CultureTip title="Ano vs AÃ±o" flag="ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡½">
MUITO IMPORTANTE: "Ano" (sem til) significa Ã¢nus em espanhol! "AÃ±o" (com til) significa ano. A diferenÃ§a Ã© crucial: "Tengo 30 aÃ±os" vs "Tengo 30 anos" sÃ£o frases BEM diferentes!
</CultureTip>

## Erros com Verbos

### Ser vs Estar

<VocabCard
  word="ERRADO: Soy cansado"
  translation="Correto: Estoy cansado"
  pronunciation="es-TOI kan-SA-do"
  example="Estoy cansado despuÃ©s del trabajo."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="ERRADO: Estoy brasileÃ±o"
  translation="Correto: Soy brasileÃ±o"
  pronunciation="soi bra-si-LE-nho"
  example="Soy brasileÃ±o, de SÃ£o Paulo."
/>

### Tener vs Haber

<VocabCard
  word="ERRADO: Tiene una fiesta maÃ±ana"
  translation="Correto: Hay una fiesta maÃ±ana"
  pronunciation="ai U-na FIES-ta ma-NHA-na"
  example="Hay una fiesta maÃ±ana. Â¿Vienes?"
/>

### ConjugaÃ§Ãµes que Confundem

<ConjugationTable
  verb="tener (cuidado!)"
  meaning="ter"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Yo", word: "tengo (nÃ£o 'tenho')" },
    { person: "TÃº", word: "tienes (nÃ£o 'tens')" },
    { person: "Ã‰l/Ella", word: "tiene (nÃ£o 'tem')" },
    { person: "Nosotros", word: "tenemos" },
    { person: "Ellos/Ellas", word: "tienen" }
  ]}
/>

## Erros com PreposiÃ§Ãµes

<VocabCard
  word="ERRADO: Voy en el cine"
  translation="Correto: Voy al cine"
  pronunciation="voi al SI-ne"
  example="Â¿Vamos al cine esta noche?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="ERRADO: Estoy de acuerdo contigo"
  translation="Correto: Estoy de acuerdo contigo"
  pronunciation="es-TOI de a-KUER-do kon-TI-go"
  example="Tienes razÃ³n, estoy de acuerdo contigo."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="ERRADO: Pienso de ti"
  translation="Correto: Pienso en ti"
  pronunciation="PIEN-so en ti"
  example="Siempre pienso en ti."
/>

## Erros com GÃªnero de Palavras

Algumas palavras mudam de gÃªnero entre portuguÃªs e espanhol:

| PortuguÃªs | Espanhol | Cuidado! |
|-----------|----------|----------|
| O leite (masc.) | La leche (fem.) | LA leche |
| A Ã¡rvore (fem.) | El Ã¡rbol (masc.) | EL Ã¡rbol |
| O sangue (masc.) | La sangre (fem.) | LA sangre |
| A cor (fem.) | El color (masc.) | EL color |
| O sal (masc.) | La sal (fem.) | LA sal |
| A ponte (fem.) | El puente (masc.) | EL puente |

<VocabCard
  word="ERRADO: El leche estÃ¡ frÃ­o"
  translation="Correto: La leche estÃ¡ frÃ­a"
  pronunciation="la LE-che es-TA FRI-a"
  example="La leche estÃ¡ frÃ­a. Â¿La caliento?"
/>

<CultureTip title="PrÃ¡tica Constante" flag="ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡·">
O gÃªnero das palavras Ã© um dos erros mais persistentes. A Ãºnica soluÃ§Ã£o Ã© praticar muito! Quando aprender uma palavra nova, aprenda sempre com o artigo: "la leche", "el Ã¡rbol".
</CultureTip>

## Erros de Estrutura

<VocabCard
  word="ERRADO: Me gusta mucho de ti"
  translation="Correto: Me gustas mucho"
  pronunciation="me GUS-tas MU-cho"
  example="Me gustas mucho. Quiero estar contigo."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="ERRADO: El libro que yo te falei"
  translation="Correto: El libro del que te hablÃ©"
  pronunciation="el LI-bro del ke te a-BLE"
  example="Este es el libro del que te hablÃ©."
/>

## Portunhol: Evite!

| Portunhol | Espanhol Correto |
|-----------|------------------|
| Muinto | Mucho/Muy |
| EntÃ³n | Entonces |
| MÃ¡s | Pero (mas) / MÃ¡s (mais) |
| NÃ³s somos | Nosotros somos |
| Ainda | TodavÃ­a/AÃºn |
| EntÃ£o | Entonces |

<VocabCard
  word="ERRADO: MÃ¡s yo quiero ir"
  translation="Correto: Pero yo quiero ir"
  pronunciation="PE-ro yo KIE-ro ir"
  example="No quieres ir, pero yo sÃ­ quiero."
/>

## Dicas para Evitar Erros

1. **Pense em espanhol** - NÃ£o traduza do portuguÃªs
2. **Cuidado com cognatos** - Verifique se significam o mesmo
3. **Aprenda com artigos** - "La leche", nÃ£o sÃ³ "leche"
4. **Pratique pronÃºncia** - Especialmente J, Ã‘, LL
5. **PeÃ§a feedback** - Seu parceiro pode te corrigir

<CTA
  text="Quer corrigir seus erros praticando com seu parceiro?"
  buttonText="ComeÃ§ar a Aprender Juntos"
/>

articles.title: Portuguese Baby & Pregnancy Vocabulary: Essential Words for Expecting Couples
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Expecting a bebÃª with your Portuguese-speaking partner is an exciting journey. Learning the essential bebÃª and pregnancy vocabulary in Portuguese will help you participate fully in doctor visits, shopping for the quarto do bebÃª, and those precious first conversations with your little one.

For everyday communication with your partner, check out our guide on [essential Portuguese phrases for couples](/blog/en/essential-portuguese-phrases-for-couples).

<PhraseOfDay
  word="bebÃª"
  translation="baby"
  pronunciation="bebÃª"
  context="The most important word for your growing family."
/>

## Essential Pregnancy Vocabulary

<VocabCard
  word="grÃ¡vida"
  translation="pregnant"
  pronunciation="grÃ¡vida"
  example="We're esperando!"
/>

| Portuguese | English | Context |
|---|---|---|
| bebÃª | baby | Your little one |
| grÃ¡vida | pregnant | The condition |
| esperando | expecting | Anticipating baby |
| data prevista | due date | When baby arrives |
| ultrassom | ultrasound | Seeing baby |
| quarto do bebÃª | nursery | Baby's room |
| fralda | diaper | Essential item |
| mamadeira | bottle | For feeding |
| carrinho | stroller | For walks |
| berÃ§o | crib | Baby's bed |

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¹" title="Portuguese Pregnancy Traditions">
In Portuguese-speaking cultures, pregnancy is often celebrated with specific traditions. Baby showers, gender reveals, and family gatherings are common ways to welcome the new arrival. It's traditional to wait until after birth to buy certain items.
</CultureTip>

## Announcing the News

### To Your Partner's Family
- **We're esperando a bebÃª!** - The big announcement
- **You're going to be grandparents!** - For the parents
- **We have wonderful news!** - Building anticipation

### To Friends
- **We're having a bebÃª!** - Direct and joyful
- **Our family is growing!** - Gentle announcement
- **Little one on the way!** - Cute phrasing

<VocabCard
  word="esperando"
  translation="expecting"
  pronunciation="esperando"
  example="We are esperando in spring!"
/>

## At the Doctor's Office

Essential phrases for prenatal appointments:

| Portuguese | English | When to Use |
|---|---|---|
| data prevista | due date | Asking about timeline |
| ultrassom | ultrasound | For the scan |
| grÃ¡vida | pregnant | Medical discussions |
| Healthy bebÃª | healthy baby | Good news |
| esperando | expecting | General context |

### Questions to Ask
- **When is the data prevista?** - Timeline question
- **Is the bebÃª healthy?** - Health check
- **When is the next ultrassom?** - Appointment planning

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¹" title="Medical Appointments">
In Portuguese-speaking healthcare settings, prenatal care may follow specific schedules. Having your partner help translate during appointments is invaluable, or bring a translation app as backup.
</CultureTip>

## Nursery and Baby Items

### Setting Up the quarto do bebÃª

| Portuguese | English | Description |
|---|---|---|
| berÃ§o | crib | Baby's sleeping place |
| carrinho | stroller | For transportation |
| fralda | diaper | Essential supplies |
| mamadeira | bottle | Feeding equipment |
| quarto do bebÃª | nursery | Baby's room |

### Shopping Vocabulary
- **We need fraldas** - Basic necessity
- **Where are the mamadeiras?** - Store navigation
- **This berÃ§o is perfect!** - Making choices
- **The carrinho fits well** - Practical decisions

<VocabCard
  word="quarto do bebÃª"
  translation="nursery / baby's room"
  pronunciation="quarto do bebÃª"
  example="We're decorating the quarto do bebÃª."
/>

## Talking to Your Baby

Sweet phrases for your little one:

| Portuguese Phrase | English | Moment |
|---|---|---|
| Hello, little bebÃª | Hello, little baby | First greeting |
| I love you, bebÃª | I love you, baby | Any moment |
| Sleep well, little one | Sleep well | Bedtime |
| Beautiful bebÃª | Beautiful baby | Admiration |

## Baby Shower Vocabulary

| Portuguese | English | Context |
|---|---|---|
| bebÃª shower | baby shower | The celebration |
| Gift for bebÃª | baby gift | Presents |
| Congratulations | congratulations | Well-wishes |
| The quarto do bebÃª | the nursery | Showing preparations |

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¹" title="Baby Naming">
In Portuguese-speaking cultures, baby names often carry family significance or honor loved ones. Discuss naming traditions with your partner early, as choosing a name that works in both languages can be important.
</CultureTip>

## After the Baby Arrives

First moments vocabulary:

### At the Hospital
- **The bebÃª is here!** - Announcement
- **Healthy bebÃª!** - Good news
- **Beautiful bebÃª!** - First reactions

### First Days Home
- **Time to change the fralda** - Daily care
- **The bebÃª is hungry** - Feeding time
- **bebÃª is sleeping** - Quiet time

For more family vocabulary, explore our [meeting your Portuguese partner's family](/blog/en/meeting-your-portuguese-partners-family) guide.

## Quick Reference Card

| Need | Vocabulary |
|---|---|
| Announcement | We're esperando! |
| Doctor visit | data prevista, ultrassom |
| Shopping | berÃ§o, fralda, mamadeira |
| Daily care | bebÃª, fralda, mamadeira |

Your journey into parenthood in two languages will give your bebÃª the beautiful gift of bilingualism. Every word you learn in Portuguese strengthens your family bond.

<CTA />
